div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 447 Jabukovac, 20 km. NW of Negotin, S. Serbia, Yugoslavia, before 1920 Burial: c. 280 B.C. Contents: 29 AR Alexander III: 12 early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 1, Pella 3, Priene 1, Anti- goneia 1, Babylon 3, Alexandria 1, unc. 2) 5 dr. (Teos 1, Colophon 3, Sardes 1) Imit. Alexander III: 4 tetradr. Athens: 1 tetradr. Antiochus I: 1 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim) East Celts: 5 Philip II imit. 1 Larissa imit. Disposition: Negotin Vucković-Todorović, Starinar 20 (1969), pp. 391- 403, illus. The author considers this and no. 458 below (Noe 959) to be portions of the same hd. from Jabukovac. If so, how- ever, his burial date of c. 280 B.C. fails to take into account a coin of Attalus I which provides the basis for Hunter's burial date of c. 220 for Noe 959. Moreover, the provenance of Noe 959 is now considered to be Zemun, near Belgrade, and not south Serbia
